questions.question_text:
A company plans to deploy Microsoft Viva Insights.

The company has concerns with the privacy of data that is used in Viva Insights.

You need to identify the source of data that is used in Viva Insights.

What are three data sources of Viva Insights? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: True. Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies allow you to search for content in Microsoft Teams and Sharepoint Online, and export the content for review. DLP policies allow you to control how sensitive information is used, shared, and accessed, and can be used to set up rules to automatically detect, monitor, and protect confidential data. With a DLP policy, you can also search for content in Microsoft Teams and Sharepoint Online and export the content for review. This allows you to quickly identify and remediate any potential data loss issues, and to ensure that your data is being used in accordance with your policies.
True - With a DLP policy, you can also search for content in Microsoft Teams and Sharepoint Online and export the content for review

Given answers are correct: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies allow you to identify, monitor, and protect sensitive information across various services, including Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online. However, DLP policies themselves do not provide a direct feature to search for content and export it for review. To search for content and export it for review, you would typically use Microsoft Purview eDiscovery tools. These tools enable you to search across Microsoft 365 services, including Teams and SharePoint Online, and export the content for legal or compliance review

NYY, DLP Policies do not allow to search for content, this is how it works:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/dlp-microsoft-teams
N-Y- Y
Y, Y, Y. Correct Answers

discussion.content:
This statement is true. Microsoft Cloud App Security (MCAS) is a cloud application security solution that provides visibility, control, and protection of cloud applications. It integrates with the Intelligent Security Graph to generate Microsoft Defender for Identity alerts. The Graph collects, correlates, and analyzes data from a variety of Microsoft security products and services in order to provide a comprehensive view of the security posture of an organization.

MCAS also integrates with Secure Score, a security measure from Microsoft, to report the available security features that may reduce risk. Secure Score is a tool that evaluates an organization's security posture and provides advice on how to improve it.

Finally, MCAS integrates with Microsoft Power BI to automate a response when alerts are triggered. Power BI is a business analytics service from Microsoft that enables customers to analyze data and gain insights from their data. Power BI can be used to create reports, dashboards, and other business intelligence applications.
Triple Y

For the Power BI it's a no, you can integrate with Power Automate for custom alerts:

Defender for Cloud Apps integrates with Microsoft Power Automate to provide custom alert automation and orchestration playbooks. By using the connectors available in Power Automate, you can automate the triggering of playbooks when Defender for Cloud Apps generates alerts. For example, automatically create an issue in ticketing systems using ServiceNow connector or send an approval email to execute a custom governance action when an alert is triggered in Defender for Cloud Apps.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/flow-integration
You can however protect your BI data with Defender for Cloud App

Same as Q220. 
Correct Y, Y, Y.
